comments:
Build epf-composer-1.2.0-M2-win32

This cannot be reproduced consistently at this point but shows up frequently in the log. Possible actions browsing process with diagrams and opening diagrams in process editor.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.epf.common 4 0 2007-05-02 18:53:58.740
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.ActivityDetailDiagramImpl.getAllBreakdownElements(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.ActivityDetailDiagramImpl.getRealizedPrimaryTaskDescriptors(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.RoleTaskCompositeImpl.removeNode(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.RoleTaskCompositeImpl.access$1(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.RoleTaskCompositeImpl$RoleDescriptorAdapter.handleNotification(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.diagram.model.impl.NodeImpl$TransactionalNodeLink.notifyChanged(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.BasicNotifierImpl.eNotify(BasicNotifierImpl.java:230)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.ecore.impl.MultiResourceEObject.eNotify(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.dispatchNotification(NotifyingListImpl.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.remove(NotifyingListImpl.java:713)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.remove(BasicEList.java:869)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.ecore.impl.MultiResourceEObject.oppositeRemove(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.ecore.impl.MultiResourceEObject.eNotify(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.impl.TaskDescriptorImpl.setPerformedPrimarilyBy(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.impl.TaskDescriptorImpl.eSet(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.impl.BasicEObjectImpl.eSet(BasicEObjectImpl.java:654)
	at org.eclipse.epf.uma.ecore.impl.MultiResourceEObject.removeFromAllOppositeFeatures(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileXMIResourceImpl.unloaded(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileXMIResourceImpl.doUnload(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileXMIResourceImpl.doUnload(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.unload(ResourceImpl.java:1228)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileResourceSetImpl.reset(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.persistence.MultiFileResourceSetImpl.unload(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.AbstractLibraryManager.closeMethodLibrary(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.LibraryService.closeMethodLibrary(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.LibraryService.closeCurrentMethodLibrary(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.epf.library.ui.LibraryUIManager$1.execute(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

This is result of switching between libraries. Open library action will try to close existing opened library in tool, and close library action will unload all the loaded elements in the opened library. The sequence of unloading elements might causing this problem, eg: Diagram element is associated to MethodElement, if  method element is unload before diagram element which through null pointer exception when trying to unload the diagram element as its associated already unloaded. 

Check for null is introduce in the code to avoid the nullpointer exception. 

Marking as indirectly fixed.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2M3 20070615. Closed.
